Adding New Project Folders from a Workstation

New folders can be added to a StarTeam project view from your workstation. When you perform this operation, remember that:

  • The name of the new StarTeam folder does not need to be the same as the name of the original folder.

  • The working folder for the new StarTeam folder does not have to be in the same hierarchy as that of other StarTeam folders. If it uses the same drive letter as the root working folder, however, its path will be a relative path to that of the root working folder.

  • A new StarTeam folder can be created for each of the child folders of the working folder. The StarTeam folders created for these folders will initially have the same names as their working folders. The child working folders will retain their relationship to the working folder at the root of their hierarchy (that is, the working folder for the new StarTeam folder). If you change the path to this folder, you will also change the path to the child working folders, unless you manually set an absolute path.

The newly added folder assumes the parent folder’s behavior, with a few exceptions. For example, the child folder might have the Branch on change check box disabled because it would make no sense for the folder to branch.

To add a folder from your workstation to a StarTeam view:

  1. Select Folder > New from the menu. The New Folder Wizard dialog opens.

  2. Select a folder from the folder hierarchy and click Next. The new folder will be created as a child of the selected folder. (Warning: You cannot add a folder to a parent folder that is read-only.) The New Folder Wizard: Folder Name dialog opens.

  3. Enter a name for the child folder in the Folder Name text box. Use a maximum of 254 characters.

  4. Do one of the following:

    • Type or browse for the path to an existing working folder in the Working Folder text box. If you wish, you can select the original workstation folder as the working folder. Alternatively, you can enter the name of a new folder and StarTeam will create it.

    • Leave the Working Folder text box blank. If you do not specify a working folder, StarTeam will append the name of the new StarTeam folder to its parent's complete working folder path (recommended).

      • Note: If the new folder’s working folder path length exceeds the maximum working folder path length of 254 characters (including [ \ ] backslashes), StarTeam will not allow you to create the new working folder and displays an error message.  

  5. In the StarTeam Folder Description text box, type a description for the new folder. Use a maximum of 254 characters.

  6. Click Next. The New Folder Wizard: Child Folders dialog displays. The New folder's child box shows the new folder and any child folders it may have.

  7. Do one of the following:

    • To exclude a child folder from the project, select the folder and click Exclude.

    • To exclude all the child folders, click Exclude All.

      • Note: To redisplay folders you have excluded, click Reset Folders.

  8. Click Next. The New Folder Wizard: StarTeam Folders dialog displays the view folder hierarchy with the new folder added.

  9. Click Finish.

Tip: You can also add a folder to a project view by dragging a folder from Windows Explorer or Network Neighborhood to an existing project folder. The existing project folder will become the default parent of the new folder. Its working folder will be the location from which the folder was dragged.
